sentences.en: He had a strange rolling gait, like a sailor on a ship.
sentences.cn: 他走起路来怪怪的,左右摇摆, 就像船上的水手一样.

sentences.en: He walked with a rolling gait.
He walked with a rolling gait.
He walked with an awkward gait like a penguin.
sentences.cn: 他走路的步子难看得就像企鹅.

sentences.en: He was receding obliquely with a curious hurrying gait.
sentences.cn: 他歪着身子,古怪而急促地迈着步子,往后退去.

sentences.en: He was tall and bulky, but he walked with a slouching gait.
sentences.cn: 他身材高大, 但是走起路来却是无精打采的样子.
他从容的步态显示出 自信.

sentences.en: His gangling, awkward gait has earned him the name Spiderman.
sentences.cn: 他又瘦又高，动作笨拙难看，因此有了“蜘蛛人”的外号。

sentences.en: His movements were clumsy, and his gait peculiarly awkward.
sentences.cn: 他动作笨拙，步态尤其难看。

sentences.en: My animal had a quarter - moon back and a camel gait.
sentences.cn: 我的这头牲口的弓背象一弯新月,迈步象骆驼一样缓慢.

sentences.en: Prissy quickened her gait infinitesimally and Scarlett went back into the house.
sentences.cn: 百里茜这才稍稍加快了脚步,思嘉也回到屋里来.

sentences.en: She walks with a rolling gait.
The fastest gait of a horse is the gallop.
The wide rooms seemed too narrow for his rolling gait.
sentences.cn: 他这样摇摇摆摆地迈步,使这些宽敞的房间似乎显得太狭小了.

sentences.en: There may be some residual disturbances in speech and gait.
sentences.cn: 言语和步态可能有一些残留障碍.

trans.tran_cn: 步态，步法，[印，纺]花纹循环，（走，跑等的）速度
